title.narrative: Supporting inclusive economic growth through private sector development and fiscal sustainability in the Occupied Palestinian Territories (OPTs)

description.narrative: To support state building and financial independence by accelerate job creation, especially for women and youth, and improving revenue mobilisation for the PA. To achieve this we have identified four areas where the UK would engage at the policy level and backed up with financial support. Theses area include 1) addressing the water and sanitation infrastructure deficits in Gaza and helping businesses grow by adoption efficient water management practices 2) cementing the electricity deal and supporting commercial viability of the electricity utilities whilst supporting innovative solutions to help address business needs 3) easing access and movement restrictions and promoting trade and inward investment to address the OPTs widening and unsustainable trade deficit 4) supporting fiscal sustainability by addressing fiscal leakages and supporting the development of Palestinian Customs and the transfer of other tax collection responsibilities from Israel to the Palestinian Authority.

owner-org.narrative: UK - Foreign, Commonwealth and Development Office (FCDO)

mailing-address.narrative: Public Enquiry Point, Abercrombie House, Eaglesham Road, East Kilbride, Glasgow G75 8EA

sector.narrative: Public sector policy and administrative management
